author: {'steamid': '76561198066346696', 'num_games_owned': 2239, 'num_reviews': 1253, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1665172609}
review:
Качественная игрушка три-в-ряд, особых претензий к ней не возникло. Обучение просматривать необязательно, все интуитивно понятно (если что, надо собрать определенное количество конкретных "фишечек"). С каждым уровнем постепенно создаешь замок и т.д., за что дают бонусы для более простого прохождения уровней. Имеется звездочная система, которая насколько я понял больше для заинтересованности игрока, чем для пользы. Для больших звезд накапливаешь ресурсы и получаешь дополнительные пристройки к зданию. Проблема в том, что эти ресурсы выпадают случайно, либо я что-то не понял в игре.

Первое, что не понравилось, так это нужда в конце уровня скидывать неразбиваемый камушек вниз с помощью паверапов на карте, которые разбивают камни (а получаются с помощью 4-в-ряд или пять в ряд). Этот процесс может иногда неприятно затягиваться, поэтому бывает лучше приберечь паверапы к концу.
Второй минус: этот самый камушек, требуемый для концовки уровня появляется по какой-то непонятной логике. Вот я накапливаю требуемое количество "фишек" с игрового поля, а когда появится камень вообще не понимаю. Почему-то далеко не сразу... 
Третий недочет: у меня было 4/5 ресурсов и если я правильно понял игру, чтобы выбить 5 из 5 мне надо проходить все уровни выбранного мной замка заново. Если расклад дел именно таков (и на шанс выпадения ресурсов влияет только рандом, а не действия меня как игрока), то не вижу смысла морочаться из-за этих звездочек.

ГЛАВНАЯ ПРОБЛЕМА ИГРЫ - это цена. В текущих реалиях за такие деньги можно купить "топовую" игрушку (пусть и не первой свежести или выловить на скидке нечто поновее). Как никак, здесь имеется крайне однообразный геймплей, который предельно растянут по времени. Лучше бы ценник был меньше в пару раз и длительность тоже, хотя игра просто рассчитана на непритязательных игроков...

review:
Viajas por el mundo realizando grandes construcciones por encargo consiguiendo los materiales en un tablero de match-3 y otros minijuegos.

PRO
+Variedad de niveles (7 maravillas y un bonus)
+Variedad de power-ups que se van consiguiendo conforme avanzas
+Materiales extra conseguidos con minijuegos lo cual le da variedad a la jugabilidad.
+Los minijuegos extra se consiguen liberando  casillas especificas que tienen un color asignado, lo que añade estrategia.

NEUTRAL
*Ni recuerdo la música
*efectos de sonido cumplidores
*Gráficos promedio para el genero.

CONTRA
-Al liberar todo el material del tablero aparece una pieza que hay que llevar al fondo del tablero, esta pieza no se puede mover, solo cae cuando se libera espacio debajo. Esto complica conseguir combinaciones y se suele requerir usar los power ups forzosamente.

Las mecánicas en juegos match-3 están muy establecidas y este juego logra añadir suficiente variedad de mecánicas para ser una opción diferente. Aun así, de  preferencia en descuento ya que está mas barato en su versión para celulares.

review: I have a love hate relationship with this game. I have spent far more time on it then is probably worth it. I got 100% of the achievements. I have also played the android version which only works on older versions of the operating system. This would be a great game to remaster and update and give Candy Crush a run for its money. This all being said I do have some gripes. This is by far the most difficult game in the 7 wonders series by far and it took me about 60 hours to complete. The game tries its darndest to screw you over and you have to really strategically plan how you are going to win on any given level. In my case it was first the mini game blocks, then gather up the needed resources then clear the map then guiding the cornerstone down to the bottom. That's a lot of things all the while the timer is ticking faster than a top rate food fighter at a hot dog stand. It's pretty ridiculous. To get four stars on insane was really tough especially on the last of the normal wonders ( you unlock a bonus one at the end.) I was also dissatisfied with the selection of wonders in this one. For example Bimini was picked instead of say the fountain of youth and the only eastern Wonder was Shangri La. Power-up wise I found the ability to switch between power ups during a round very useful and added a level of strategy that wasn't possible in prior games. On the mobile version there was a bug where if you needed a shuffle the map wouldn't really do a good job and have to shuffle over and over again every couple moves. One time I had it happen on PC where it had to shuffle twice in a row which took up precious time and was frustrating. The other annoyance about that is on the mobile version those notifications would cover up the board posing a frustration that had me pulling my hair out. Despite all these things, I will look back fondly on this game even if it isn't an A game it is definitely a B- 3/5 star wonder.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066202521', 'num_games_owned': 3403, 'num_reviews': 683, 'playtime_forever': 383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 383, 'last_played': 1572392034}
review:
[h1][b]7 Wonders: Magical Mystery Tour[/b][/h1]
Jogo divertido e dinâmico, não é tão bom quanto Alien Makeover, mas dá pra se divertir.

[h1]Arte e Trilha Sonora[/h1]
[b]Arte: 7/10[/b]
O visual é legal, mas não tem nada de especial, diferente de Alien Makeover você não tem o campo para montar seus monumentos, mas ainda assim é visualmente bonito.

[b]Trilha Sonora: 7/10[/b]
A trilha sonora é relaxante, não tem nada de especial como Bejeweled que tem uma trilha sonora impactante, mas se encaixa bem no jogo. Na arte podemos dizer que é ok.

[h1]Jogabilidade e Mecânica[/h1]
[b]Jogabilidade: 9/10[/b]
Como é um jogo de combinar 3, logo seu objetivo é combinar três ou mais pedras, para então quebrar todas as células, após quebrar todas as células um bloco aparece e você deve levá-lo até o final do tabuleiro, algumas pedras tem recursos dentro e você tem que recolher todos os recursos para construir a maravilha antes que o tempo acabe, pedra, pedra preciosa, folha e água, também as células coloridas que liberam minijogos para recolher ouro e um monumento. Cada maravilha precisa de 3 - 4 estrelas para liberar a 8ª maravilha que precisa de um novo elemento alienígena. Você possui quatro dificuldades, a Zen que não tem tempo e mais três dificuldades que definem a velocidade de tempo dos tabuleiros.

[b]Mecânica: 9/10[/b]
A mecânica é bem legal, como disse acima você possui diversos objetivos dentro de um tabuleiro e pra isso você conta com uma mecânica de poderes bem legais. Combinando 4 peças você cria um especial que destrói uma linha, cinco peças uma especial que destrói uma cruz e depois de usar N especiais aprece um que destrói algumas peças aleatórias. E tem os poderes que te permitem trocar uma peça de lugar com a outra, destruir uma coluna, destruir uma célula específica, destruir uma cor específica, etc...

[h1]Considerações Finais[/h1]
Magical Mystery Tour é bem dinâmico, você possui diversos objetivos de uma vez, não basta apenas combinar três peças, deve combinar as 3 peças de forma que você consiga coletar todos os recursos, limpar todas as células, limpar as células coloridas e terminar todos os minijogos, isso deixa o jogo divertido e difícil de enjoar pois são tantos objetivos que você termina o tabuleiro e nem percebe o tempo que passou e fica com aquela vontade de jogar mais um pouco. O modo insano pode dar um desafio bem legal.

review:
[h1]So I've now finished all of the 5 "7 Wonders"-Games playable on Steam[/h1] 

[b]and want to give out my opinion on all of them, therefore I paid every game a little visit again to compare them once and for all. Starting the review, first, I've made a Top 5 for you to get a good first look on how much I like it:[/b]

[td]4,5/10[/td]
[/tr]
[/table]


[b]While it was the last one of the 7 Wonders-games I played, it definitely was my favourite of the bunch. Why that is, I’ll tell you now, obviously starting with the positive.[/b]

[b]This game makes it all right.[/b] Great & fun power-ups which are all available during the game and refillable by matching, typical clean Match 3-gameplay and great buildings to build once again. While it has the perfect amount of playtime and stuff to do, it still has different gamemodes to play. For example, offering a „Zen“-mode for the people that hate time limitations in such games, as it gives you as much time you need to solve a level. Otherwise, if „Normal“ is too easy for you, you can try „Advanced“ or even „Insane“, both giving you a great challenge. It also offers multiple other features which you can discover, as for example mini games.

[b]Barely any negatives that I can think of.[/b] It obviously can get monotone over time, as every 7 Wonders-game can, but 1. were they made to be a casual game, a little time burner, and 2. is this part of the franchise one of the less monotone ones. Another thing I noticed is that you can’t save during a round, it’s only able to save your gamestate after a finished board, which shouldn’t really be a problem as a board will take 3-7 minutes.

Considering this dear game has alot going for it and barely anything negative, a [b]9,5/10[/b] is deserved here. Recommendable to both people looking for a Match 3-Game and general fans of the genre, this game will please you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092241169', 'num_games_owned': 820, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 2480, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2480, 'last_played': 1559248407}
review:
Игра "три в ряд", обёрнутая в некоторое подобие сюжета и с атласом для перехода между картами разной сложности. Карты состоят из нескольких схем, на которых мы должны собирать ресурсы для "строительства".

На мой вкус, это лучшая игра в серии 7 Wonders: возможность двигать фишки пока игра коллапсирует ряды в другой части карты; нет "жизней" (если не уложились во время, всегда можно переиграть уровень); текста немного, но всё более-менее понятно; достижения (в погоне за которыми можно продлить геймплей в 2-3 раза минимум).

Болезни, к сожалению, те же самые: устаревшая графика (либо фулскрин в низком разрешении, либо мелкое немасштабируемое окошко), отсутствие локализации (хотя некоторые разработчики явно с русскими именами), нет интеграции со Steam (достижения только внутриигровые, нет облачного сохранения), не совсем удобный интерфейс выбора карт и переигровки.

К счастью (или к сожалению?), болезни не мешают этой игре со страшной силой пожирать ваше время, когда вы залипаете в ней. Так что [b]4+ из 5[/b]. К сожалению, сама игра коротковата (даже с учётом достижений) - моё время в этой игре включает её прохождение дважды со всеми достижениями.

PS: Мой [url=https://steamcommunity.com/profiles/76561198092241169/recommended/16030/]обзор[/url] (негативный) на другую игру из серии 7 Wonders - [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/16030/7_Wonders_Treasures_of_Seven/]Treasures of Seven[/url].

review:
非常不错的三消游戏
已建造各大文明建筑为背景
过关条件为消除所有背景方块后将出现的砖块掉落到最底端
其中每关还可以通过消除指定颜色砖块从而获得建筑材料的奖励

游戏非常人性化的在于你可以使用好几种特殊技能来帮助你完成关卡，这些技能只需要在消除界面左侧选择或者直接拖动使用即可
使用技能后会进入充能，依靠消除的其他方块来恢复能量，恢复后即可再次使用
虽然有多个技能，但每次只能为选择的技能充能
这些技能非常有帮助，比如可以消除一竖排、炸掉3X3小范围的目标、交换指定方块等等，不会遇到某些角落就是消除不了只能不停消灭其他地方、等到无法移动而重置的尴尬

难度不高，全剧情大概4个多小时就可以通关，算是非常不错的消遣小游戏

[h1]About the game.[/h1]

You will have construction workers and they will build a wonder for you if you give them stone blocks. Each match will provide you some construction resources for the wonder and there are cornerstones and capstones. These stones will have to be moved all the way down on your playfield so your builders are able to construct wonders. There are runes that has a stone outlining and they need to be destroyed along with the corner/cap stones to win the level. Corner and capstones can't be swapped they will block fire and iceballs.

review:
Not the worst 7 Wonders game, and as a match-3 it's pretty good. The graphics are pretty good, there is some moderate amount of humor, and the gameplay is nearly perfect. I have some reservations on the drop speed of gems, and the usual chaos on screen when you reach the last couple Wonders which have too many things going on. Also, the soundtrack is pretty mediocre -- a strong negative point for casual games.

And finally, hmm... Speaking of casual, I don't understand why the casual ('Zen') mode, which is untimed and allows you to chill out, decides to punish you by preventing you from playing the bonus mini-games -- which are to casual gaming what Rick & Morty is to Twin Peaks on Sunday night: a bit of fresh air between intense sessions*. This isn't good. I'm still going to recommend, but I'd STRONGLY recommend Alien Makeover and, above them all, the excellent 7 Wonders Treasures of Seven. (I'd also recommend the unrelated, all-time great Heroes of Hellas 2 & 3. But that's just me being obsessed with their near-perfection.)

* This review will no longer be valid a couple weeks after this review was posted. I'm a rebel, living in the moment, and I have no idea what will be on TV in six months. Is it future or is it past?

author: {'steamid': '76561198031726534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1420068541}
review:
A match three game. Beating it on normal took about five hours.

The goal of the game is to construct wonders. That takes resources which you get by matching gems. You can only get a limited amount of resources per level so you have to play about seven levels to complete a wonder. That is if you manage to get the maximum amount of resources every level. If not, you have to complete more levels. Each wonder also requires you to complete two minigames. The minigames have to be unlocked by collecting keys while playing the levels.

To complete a level, you have to break background tiles by matching gems on top of them. After the tiles are all broken, a special gem appears that you have to get all the way to the bottom by matching the gems underneath it. Once the special gem reaches the bottom, the level is complete. You also have a time limit, but I do not know what happens if you run out of time since it never happened to me. 

The levels vary in shape and the amount of background tiles that need to be broken increases as you go along. The background tiles also become more durable, requiring multiple matches to break. There are also special abilities you can use that recharge when you match gems. Matching four or more gems spawns special gems that can clear whole rows at a time.

To put it all together, you start playing a level. You match gems until you have collected the minigame keys and maxed your resources. Then you break all the background tiles. Then you lower the special gem to the bottom of the screen, completing the level. Now you can spend your resources on building the wonder. Then rinse and repeat until the wonder is complete. Then you start a new wonder. It's a simple diversion that kept my attention for the scant few hours I played it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016179939', 'num_games_owned': 2437, 'num_reviews': 108, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1417979529}
review:
[b]Brief Synopsis[/b]

7 Wonders: Magical Mystery Tour is one of many tile matching games in the 7 Wonders series. There are seven levels in total with each level having several sub levels. In each level there are also two mini games which you can finish to get gold and statues with which to decorate the wonder you're building. To build them, you must match tiles in lines of three or more. A match larger than three tiles rewards you with special tiles. Clearing the tiles also rewards you by powering up special powers. 

[b]Long Review[/b]

     [i]Story[/i]: In this game, you've been hired by the gods to build various buildings/cities of myth and legend. 

     [i]Graphics[/i]: The art assets are pretty good, though the multiple colours of the tiles in later levels can be a bit overwhelming due to there being so many on the board at once.

     [i]Music/Sounds[/i]: The music and sound fx are simple, but pleasing to listen to. They do get a bit samey towards the end, but they're also easy to tune out. 

     [i]Length[/i]:  It took me about 5 hours to complete the game. For the price, this isn't too bad. 

     [i]Replayability[/i]: There isn't much in the way of replayability in this game. Once you've completed all the levels and          beat the two mini games in each level, that's pretty much all there is.

This game is simple and casual in nature. If you like matching games, I recommend it. Due to it not having much, if any, replayability however, only get it when it's on sale.
